intro: Hemigenia buccinata, commonly known as the broad-leaved hemigenia, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and spikes of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Hemigenia buccinata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
